sentences: Børge-Are Halvorsen (born 12 October 1978 in Lillehammer, Norway) is a Norwegian Jazz musician (soprano, alto, tenor and baritone saxophone and c- and alto flute).
His family moved to Sandane in Gloppen where he spent his youth, but he was later a freelance musician resident of Oslo since 2003.
Halvorsen studied music at Firda vidaregåande skule (1994–97), then at "Viken Folkehøgskole" (1997–98) and at last on the Department of Music, Rhythmic studies at Universitetet i Agder (1998-02).
Since 2006 he has been engaged as Lecturer in saxophone and jazz improvisation at Norges Musikkhøgskole, since 2010 also at Department of Musicology Universitetet i Oslo.
He also works as an arranger, much in connection with horn section or big band.

Halvorsen plays with "Ensemble Denada", "Examination of What", Ole Børud, "Ekvilibrium", "Vinni", "Penthouse Playboys", "Hans Orkester", "Steffen Isaksens Orkester", "KABA Orchestra" and "Jon Haaland Big Band".

Has also appeared in the bands Paperboys, Dance with a Stranger, Karpe Diem, Sharp Nine, "Smiths Venner", Jens Wendelboe Crazy Energy Orchestra, "Mathilde Grooss Viddal/FriEnsemblet", Kjell Karlsens Orkester, "Bjørn W W Jørgensen Storband", Chipahua, The New Swing Generation, "The Fabulous Couldhavebeens", "The New Jordal Swingers", "Soulslave", The Sinatra Songbook, "Soul, Inc.", "Soul Insurance" and "Earplay", and is also musical director of the Big Band "Bjørvika Business Band" since 2010.
Halvorsen has participated on the following productions:
2003–05: Hjertelig hilsen Hege og Kjersti, Dizzie Showteater/norgesturné
2006: En kveld med Thomas og Harald...
It's Showtime, Chat Noir/Drammen Teater/Oseberg Kulturhus
2008: Singin' In The Rain, Oslo Nye
Swingin' Home For Christmas (Alexander Rybak), norgesturné
2010: Kåre, Linn, men Christian Skolmen, Chat Noir
Øivind Blunck – Rett og slett, Dizzie Showteater
Halvorsen has contributed musically to the following productions:
UMOJA – The Cultural Flying Carpet (African Broadcasting Union)
Halvorsen has contributed to the following releases:
Soria Moria, with Nissa Nyberget & Elisabeth Lindland, nominated for the 2004 children music Spellemannprisen
Falkner Street, with Number Seven Deli
Bigbandblast!, with Børre Dalhaug, nominated for the 2004 jazz Spellemannprisen
Love Will Haunt You Down, with The Margarets
Birdie Blues, with Hilde Louise Asbjørnsen
Denada, Norske Store Orkester/Helge Sunde, nominated for the 2006 jazz Spellemannprisen
Hjerteknuser, with Jan Eggum, nominated for the 2007 male artist Spellemannprisen
Sudoku, with Sharp Nine, nominated for the 2007 jazz Spellemannprisen
It's Beginning To Look A Lot Like Christmas, with Marian Aas Hansen
While I Walk You Home, with Dylan Mondegreen
Antonsen Big Band, with Antonsen Big Band
Eg veit i himmerik ei borg, with Jan Werner
Elske I Sneen, with Penthouse Playboys
2008: Hold on Be Strong, with Maria Haukaas Storeng
True Colours, with Erlend Bratland, nominated for the 2008 newcomer Spellemannprisen
Shakin' The Ground, with Ole Børud
Twenty Years Erased, with The Margarets
Pappa, ikke gå så fort..., with Axel Hellstenius
Finding Nymo, with Ensemble Denada, awarded ECHO Preis for this Year's big band album, by German record company organisation
Edvard Grieg In Jazz Mood, with Kjell Karlsen Big Band
Neste stasjon Grorud, with Finn Kalvik & Erik Fosnes Hansen
The Best of Me Is You, with Heine Totland (single)
Examination of What (Losen Records), with Håvard Fossum Børge-Are Halvorsen Qrt
Visa vid vindens ängar, with Alexander Rybak
Hope Is Happiness, with Hilde Dahl
No More Than Necessary, with The Douglas Group
For Your Soul, with Jens Andreas Kleiven
Little Brother – Out of the Pit, with Rune Brodahl
2013: 20 År Midt I Musikken - Hit'er & Favoritter - Live (Da Works), with Trine Rein
Sources Of Inspiration (AMP Music & Records), with Anders Thorén Quartet -
2014: I Go To The Rock (TAMU), with Oslo Gospel Choir
The Musical Messiah (TAMU), with Oslo Gospel Choir
